EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.93}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Financial Tech and Market Share or the cell corresponding to Risk Management and Profit?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Financial Tech} and {Market Share} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Real Estate and Risk or the cell corresponding to Real Estate and Valuation?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Real Estate} and {Valuation} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Tax and Liabilities or the cell corresponding to Tax and Valuation?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Tax} and {Valuation} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.30 to 0.45?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Investments, Assets), (Real Estate, Assets), (Investments, Liabilities), (Real Estate, Liabilities), (Real Estate, Market Share), (Risk Management, Market Share), (Risk Management, Profit), (Tax, Profit)}.
